gw.api.util

Class TempDeferredOutputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • org.apache.commons.io.output.ThresholdingOutputStream
        • org.apache.commons.io.output.DeferredFileOutputStream
          • gw.api.util.TempDeferredOutputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class TempDeferredOutputStream
extends org.apache.commons.io.output.DeferredFileOutputStream
    This class will permit writing output to an in memory structure or a temporary File if it exceeds a threshold. On consuming the contents of this class, the close will delete the file. This was created for dealing with large memory consumption in creating documents using Gosu templates.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TempDeferredOutputStream()
      This will create a instance of this class using utf8 as the encoding and 10k threshold.
      TempDeferredOutputStream(int threshold)
      This will create a instance of this class with the specified encoding and specified threshold.
      TempDeferredOutputStream(int threshold, java.lang.String extension)
      This will create a instance of this class with the specified encoding and specified threshold.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.io.InputStream consumeContents()
      This is how you consume the bytes written.

    • Method Detail

      • consumeContents

        public java.io.InputStream consumeContents()
                                    throws java.io.IOException
        This is how you consume the bytes written. Note that this will only work once if the size exceeded the threshold, the close of the input stream will delete the file.
        Returns:
        an InputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it can not construct the input stream.
